admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF040753-AZERBAIJAN: HEALTH, PENSION AND
            SOCIAL PROTECTION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Health Reform Project for Azerbaijan
            aims to test ways to strengthen and reform district primary
            health care services. There are three project components.
            The first component stimulates a national dialogue on policy
            changes needed for health reform in Azerbaijan; generates
            support in the Government for the reform process itself;
            introduces a common understanding of terms and objectives
            such as productivity and cost-effectiveness; performs
            critical assessments related to health financing reform; and
            strengthens capacity in the health ministry to plan,
            implement, and evaluate health reforms by developing a
            management information system, and by developing new
            pharmaceutical policies and procedures. The second component
            implements a number of reforms that have been previously
            piloted by UNICEF in Azerbaijan: the rationalization of
            health care services; the implementation of primary health
            care models; the improvement of and access to primary care
            services; and the strengthening of managerial and clinical
            capabilites of health personnel. The third component
            supports the project coordination unit and a monitoring and
            evaluation program.
